# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) > text_width
            # Handle words longer than the specified width
            # For simplicity, we'll just add them to a new line
            push!(lines, "")
            push!(lines, word)
        else
            # Add word to current line if it fits
            if length(join(lines; " ")) + length(word) <= text_width
                push!(lines, word)
            else
                # If the line is full, add a newline and start a new line
                push!(lines, "")
                push!(lines, word)
            end
        end
    end
    return join(lines; "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The above code will output:

```
This is a very
long sentence that
should be wrapped
into multiple lines.
```
